items.title: First Tick: Here are the top global cues for today’s trade
items.description: The GIFT Nifty is a trading firm, indicating a positive start for the day. Wall Street stocks ended mixed on Friday, with Nvidiaclimbing and Microsoft dipping, while Treasury yields declined a day after U.S. President Donald Trump unveiled reciprocal tariff plans but stopped short of imposing new ones.

items.description: Stocks To Watch, Feb 17: Stocks like Narayana Hrudayalaya, Dilip Buildcon, NRB Bearings, Rail Vikas Nigam, Borosil Renewables, Aditya Birla Fashion & Retail, La Opala RG, Dish TV India, Gujarat Narmada Valley Fertilizers and Chemicals, Easy Trip Planners, Wipro,Ujjivan Small Finance Bank, and Shriram Finance will be in focus on February 17.

items.description: Industry consultants and managements of IT companies indicate a stable or relatively better technology spending in 2025

items.title: DOMS Industries: Gaining traction with consistent performance
items.description: The integration of the Uniclan business, continuous capacity addition, and diversified product segment are driving growth

items.title: Agri Picks Report February 17, 2025: Geojit Financial Services
items.description: According to Geojit Financial Services, The Cotton Association of India has lowered its January estimate for the country's cotton production for 2024-25 (OctSept) to 30.18 million bales (1 bale = 170 kg). In December, it had estimated the country's cotton production at 30.43 million bales.

items.title: Live: How much can Nifty fall if it breaks below 22,800? | Opening Bell
items.description: Indian markets extended losses for the eighth straight day, marking first such decline in two years. Amidst broad-based selloff, Nifty slipped below 22,950 amid FII outflows and US President Donald Trump's reciprocal tariff jitters. This week, investors will keenly watch out FII flows, Trump's tariff announcements, and rupee-dollar rate. Among stocks, watch out for Aditya Birla Fashion, Utkarsh Small Finance Bank, and RVNL in today's trading session. Catch Lovisha Darad in conversation with Sudeep Shah, Head of Technical & Derivative Research, SBI Securities and Mayuresh Joshi, Head - Equity Research India, William O'Neil and Company.

items.title: MC Pro Budget 2025 Portfolio: 18 stocks to benefit from an eventual market revival
items.description: The MC Pro Research team has combined a top-down approach taking inspiration from the budget with bottom-up stock picking, giving due consideration to valuations amid market volatility

items.title: RVNL shares drop 7% after firm's Q3 net profit declines 13% to Rs 311 crore
items.description: The railway company's revenue from operations declined nearly 3 percent year-on-year to Rs 4,567 crore in Q3 FY25.

items.title: Zen Tech share price hits 20% lower circuit after Q3 numbers
items.description: While Zen Tech's Q3 earnings showed year-on-year growth, a sharp decline was seen when compared to the previous quarter.

items.title: United Breweries, United Spirits shares jitter after India lowers tariff on US whiskies
items.description: The revised tariff applies solely to bourbon whiskies, which are uniquely produced and aged in the U.S., while all other alcoholic beverages remain taxed at the previous 150% rate.
